main event: A point of light, pulsing and flashing, was observed moving across the sky in Huntington, West Virginia in January 1964.
interesting points: The object appeared to be moving at a high speed and made sharp turns, zig-zagging before disappearing.
The object was observed to be slightly north and above a bright star-like object, which served as a reference point.
The witness described the object as being about a third the brightness and size of the bright reference star.
The object was observed for approximately 1.5 to 2.5 minutes before disappearing.
The witness suggested that the sightings may be related to improved saucer technology and scheduled observations in the area.
sighted object: a pulsing, flashing point of light
